result.execSummary:
The defendant Beth M. Mittelstadt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Beth M. Mittelstadt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Beth M. Mittelstadt was found guilty of 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Beth M. Mittelstadt was found guilty of 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant, Beth M. Mittelstadt with Attorney Chris A. Gramstrup appeared (both by phone).  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(9:36)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
State - on March 11, 2016 was given until May 31 to file any motions - defense has not done so
Gramstrup - requests motion deft filed be dismissed

COURT:  Grants dismissal of motion
Gramstrup to prepare order

Defendant, Beth M. Mittelstadt, in custody, appeared with Attorney Chris A. Gramstrup (by Phone).  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(9:23)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
State - deft had filed in Dec that she wanted to withdraw her plea, had hearing on Jan 7 an attorney wasn't established, Mr. Gramstrup is pursuing Post Conviction Relief

Gramstrup - hasn't recd any transcripts or court file yet - requests matter continued
State - requests another status

COURT:  haven't made a decision with regard to deft's request 
file any motions no later then May 31, 2016 - set matter 30 - 45 days later

  Status conference scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Beth M. Mittelstadt, in custody, appeared with Attorney John M. O'Boyle.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(10:08)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
State - filed Restitution Worksheet - requests court not rely on compass evaluation
State - calls Carrie Anderson addresses the court

*State argues over $52,000 restitution requested (worksheet filed) - submits 6  photographs of home - K.B. requesting $29,000 rest. - submits 5 photographs of weapon, violent force & damage deft did - requests prison sentence:  14CF397 - 1 1/2 yrs IC 2 yrs ES - pay rest $57,560.80,  $518 cc - n/c w/Dean or Cheryl Ferry or residence E6838 St Hwy 170, Colfax, WI & n/c Katie Bundy or her residence --- 15CF01 Ct 1 - 7 1/2 yrs IC 3 yrs ES - consecutive to 14CF397 - pay $518 cc, n/c w/William Anderson and residence (State will provide address) --- Ct 3 - 5 yrs IC 2 yrs ES - consecutive to 14CF397 & 15CF1 Ct 1 - $518 cc - n/c w/Todd Kurtzhals --- total prison 14 yrs IC 7 yrs ES 

*O'Boyle - argues sentence - submits letter from Deputy Pyka on deft's programs participated in & completed - not exceed the recommendation of PSI and have an imposed and stayed sentence and probation

*Defendant makes statement - Mr. O'Boyle reads statement

***(11:19) COURT:  addresses both counsel and defendant
14CF397 - Prison: 3 1/2 yrs - 1 1/2 IC, 2 yrs ES concurrent to 15CF1 Ct 2 & 3
$518 fine ($268 cc & $250 surchg) - PAYMENT PLAN
maintain sobriety and no bars/taverns where principle sale is alcohol, no possession of knife or any weapons, no contact with any known drug users or dealer - submit dna  sample
Restitution: $57,560.80 (worksheet submitted) - prison wages to go towards restitution
n/c w/Dean & Cheryl Ferry or their residence E6838 St. Hwy 170 Colfax, WI & n/c w/Katie Bundy or her residence
eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program

15CF1 Ct 2 - Prison:  10 yrs w/7 yrs IC 3 yrs ES  concurrent w/14CF397
$518 fine ($268 cc & $250 surchg) - PAYMENT PLAN
n/c w/ William Anderson and his family and their residence (State will provide address)

15CF1 Ct 3 - Prison:  10 yrs w/ 7 yrs IC 3 yrs ES concurrent w/14CF397 and 15CF1 Ct 2
$518 fine ($268 cc & $250 surchg) - PAYMENT PLAN
n/c w/Todd Kurtzhals

Credit 322 days
ineligible to vote and possess firearm and body armor prohibition
from Atty. O'Boyle re: sentencing and transcript documents  - note: pictures scanned are best quality available

O'Boyle - emailed Mr. Bachman to get copy of file - spoke with deft a week ago - is going to seek approval to get psych eval. for sentencing

COURT:  have time to get that done - file any continuance within 20 days of sentencing
nothing further needed

(3:59)  matter recalled per the request of DA & Bachman
State - Bachman is moving to withdraw
Bachman - addresses the court and requests to withdraw

COURT:  allows Mr. Bachman to withdraw - Bachman to contact office to appt a new atty  Review hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant, Beth M. Mittelstadt, in custody, appeared with Attorney John Charles Bachman.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(2:12)
Deft - had sent letter to court
Bachman - deft was discussed with on his PD appt and had already fired Chapman and the rule is only one new atty
COURT:  addresses the deft 
Orders contact with Atty to take place and we'll take up anything further at sentencing
Deft - wants to go to sentencing alone 
COURT:  won't allow deft to go to sentencing alone

Defendant, Beth M. Mittelstadt, in custody, appeared with Attorney John Charles Bachman.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(4:16)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
State - ***AMENDED CRIMINAL COMPLAINT filed in 14cf397 plea to that and Ct 2 & 3 in 15CF1 - PSI will be requested
Deft - correct statement

Deft - 14CF397    - pleads - no contest)  waives rights & JT
          15CF1 Ct 2 - pleads - no contest)  waives rights & JT
          15CF1 Ct 3 - pleads - no contest)  waives rights & JT

***Orders PSI ***
Bachman goes over her rights not to vote, no firearms
Bond continues

DISMISS:  15CF1 Ct 1 & 4, 15CM1  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
to withdraw counsel/  Sent to Judge for Review/Signature

Defendant, Beth M. Mittelstadt, in custody, appeared with Attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(1:42)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
Hearing on deft's pro se letter requesting new counsel and speedy trial 
Chapman - moves to withdraw, public defenders office is in process of appointing new counsel
Deft wants new attorney
COURT:  Mr. Chapman is competent attorney

COURT:  14CF397 Jury trial date speedy request - June 18th and 19th at 8:30 a.m. - FPT - June 5 at 11:30
Grants withdraw of Dan Chapman as counsel - motions & spec instructs by May 29, 2015
15CM1 & 15CF1 both remain on November calendar for jury trial
for speedy trial and substitution of attorney/  Sent to Judge for Review/Signature

COURT:  14CT397 as #1 - 15CF1 #2 - 15CM1 #3
spec motions and instruc five days prior to FPT
